dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim, high-ceilinged. Gutted of half its pews. Broken stained glass windows. Vandalized statues of saints. Iconoclastic clutter lies beneath rusted, wrought iron st of votive candles. At the chapel's front: a decapitated Jesus hangs from a charred wooden cross above where an altar once stood. The altar space: converted to a computer work station. Pi of carelessly stashed discs and printouts abound. Sacristy doorways lead to kitchen and bathroom. An unmade brass bed sits off to one side. In an alcove off to the other side, a SHRINE. Candles bur in a votive stand. Framed pictures hang above it, their faces turned to the wall. A tormented FIGURE sits at the computer... Meet: QOHEN LETH, 40s, gaunt, pale and completely hairles His hands clench and unclench above his keyboard as he st mesmerized at the swirling image of a BLACK HOLE SCREENSA His rotary phone RINGS. Qohen blinks out of his trance, a look of panic on his fa and reaches for the phone... too late. The phone stops ringing before he can answer it. Qohen MOANS softly and turns back to his computer. He tap key and the screensaver disappears, replaced by a scrolli flurry of esoteric symbols. He types frenetically, eyes focused intensely. The phone RINGS. Qohen snatches the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello? No answer. Qohen SIGHS, slowly hangs up the receiver, and returns hi attention to the computer screen. He begins typing again.  His wind-up clock RINGS. Its hands read 5:09. Qohen jumps. He slaps the alarm off, rubs his eyes as if he's just awakened. Standing and stretching, he raises hi eyes to the disfigured crucifix before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen stands in his small galley kitchen, waiting for the microwave to finish, an open container of generic "INSTAN OATMEAL" on the counter in front of him. An open cupboard above reveals various food products, all bland, all tasteless, all generically packaged in white w block black lettering. Qohen methodically sets the counter with plate, napkin, spoon... and, after retrieving the spoon from its drawer, notices a steak knife. He picks it up, studies its edge, then... gently traces a forearm vein, like an architect drawing a blueprint. The knife draws blood. Qohen stares at it. The microwave BEEPS. The wall phone RINGS. Qohen looks confused for a moment. Then, frantic and hopeful, he lunges for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Hello? He listens, face turning bland.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No... We're sorry... We're afraid you have the wrong number. Qohen hangs up, takes his steaming bowl of oatmeal from t microwave. He stands at the counter, spoon in hand, stari at the bowl with slight distaste: just another job to do. He absently brings his wrist to his mouth, tastes the blo His face sours. He grabs his napkin and wipes his tongue clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen stares at himself in the mirror as he brushes his teeth. He spits, takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clad in black, sleeves and collar buttoned, Qohen pops a out of his computer and slips it into his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: SHRINE
dialogues.text: Qohen lights a candle. He stares at one of the picture frames, then carefully turns it to reveal its hidden phot

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: Standing on the front porch of a suburban home, Qohen's W holds their baby SON in her arms, both smiling at the cam She holds the baby's hand up in a pudgy-fingered wave. Standing behind the two, YOUNG QOHEN beams with pride.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Qohen gazes at the photo, then bows his head, fighting hi emotion. He turns the picture's face to the wall again. He walks down the long aisle to the chapel door, opens it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen approaches a great oak door. He hesitates as he touches the doorknob, bracing himself, then opens it... -..to a blast of light and STREET NOISES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen exits. Colorful graffiti mars words etched in stone above the door: "THE BROTHERHOOD OF THE INEFFABLE NAME". He hurries past caged storefronts, eyes downcast. Near his bus stop, Qohen sees a GIRL, 10, sitting on the beside a toppled bicycle. She holds a skinned knee, CRYIN Qohen hesitates, looks around. No one else is there to he He approaches the Girl cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We hate to impose ourselves, but... may we assist you in any way? The Girl covers her face with her hands, still CRYING. Qohen stares at her helplessly, then moves to her bike. A bent fender scrapes the front wheel when he tests it. tries to pry the fender back into shape. The Girl drops her hands from her face.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Leave my bike alone! Leave it alone! A SIREN sounds close by, and a helmeted MOTORCYCLE COP sk up to the curb, engine ROARING. He turns off the siren, dismounts, slowly approaches Qohen and the girl.

dialogues.speaker: MOTORCYCLE COP
dialogues.text: Please step back from the child, sir.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We were simply attempting to --

dialogues.speaker: MOTORCYCLE COP
dialogues.text: Put down the bike and step back. Qohen gently lays down the bicycle. His bus passes, and he hastens to his stop. The bus door opens. Qohen looks at the Motorcycle Cop comforting the crying Girl. His face tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen sits alone in the rear seat. The bus jumps and jostles. Qohen shuts his eyes, hands folded as if in pray TRAFFIC NOISES BLARE in a crescendo of anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neat and orderly. No sign of personal belongings. One poster adorns the wall: a man's torso in a sharply- tailored taupe suit. Bold letters proclaim: "MANAGEMENT". Smaller script reads: "Everything's Under Control." A video camera (labeled MANCAM) records Qohen's every mov Except Qohen doesn't move. He simply sits staring at his computer monitor, trancelike. The image on the monitor shows Qohen from behind, staring an image of himself on his monitor staring at an image of himself... ad infinitum. His phone RINGS. Qohen slowly comes back to reality as the phone continues RINGING. Finally, he picks up the receiver.  A female COMPUTERIZED VOICE speaks.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello -- Qohen Leth -- Corporate Health Maintenance has approved review of your disability request for today at 14:40. Please be prompt.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We are nothing if not prompt. Qohen hangs up, glances at his watch. He touches his keyboard: the image of himself shrinks to the screen's up corner, replaced by a column of flashing signs, cryptic symbols, formulae and numerals. Qohen frowns and with some effort begins typing. MR. JOBY, 20s, appears in the cubicle's doorway, scratchi an elusive itch inside his ill-fitting suit coat. He is a soft, manic-looking man with shaggy hair and beard.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: How's it hanging, Quinn?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: (without looking up) It's Qohen, Mr. Joby, and, as we've told you before, it isn't hanging at all well. We're dying.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Again? Better see the medics about that.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We have an appointment this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Not this afternoon, Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: You approved it.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Cancel it. You got that Transfinite Quantum Paradox Project due today.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We attached it to you yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Good work. But you still have that Whatchacallit Project due next week.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: The Neural Synaptic Intervention Project. Also finished. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tautologics Division is running the standard redundancies.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Whoa! You did all that this morning?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We did it all at home last night. As we've told you repeatedly, we find our work environment... distressing. The people, the lighting, the noise, the interruptions, the... the people... (taking a deep breath) Considering our at-home output, we can't begin to imagine why you insist on our coming here each day. Joby removes his suit coat and reaches over his shoulder pursue a particularly shy itch.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: That's a Management decision, Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Qohen. Q--no U--O-H-E-N.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Out of my hands.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should talk to Management. Joby stifles a guffaw, then casually drapes his suit over the ManCam.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: (voice lowered) Nobody talks to Management, Quinn. No way, no how, nuh-uh, nyetskis. Take my advice. Knock off the bitching and moaning. It's not all that bad here.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: It's worse than you can imagine, Mr. Joby, but we could suffer the wear and tear on our nerves if only we weren't afraid of missing our call.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Your call...

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Yes, our call. We've mentioned it a number of times.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: .»-. Ain't ringing a bell. coat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're expecting a certain phone call, a call we've been waiting for all our lives, a call that will give our lives purpose and meaning, and each minute we spend here, we fear we may be missing it.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. That call. Um... How about letting your machine take it? Or get call forwarding. I guess I could bend the rules on personal calls in your case.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We have to be home to receive it. Joby shakes his head, stumped. He moves behind Qohen and massages his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: I feel for you, Quinn, but there's nothing I can do.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: (stiffening) We prefer not to be touched. Joby stops, steps back.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've been extremely patient, Mr. Joby, but we're afraid we must now issue an ultimatum. Either you let us work at home, or we will be forced to resign.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: You can't quit, Quinn! You're the best cruncher I got! Qohen turns back to his computer and resumes typing.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: If our meeting with Health Maintenance is successful, the issue will be settled. If not, you leave us no choice.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: You're killing me! Be reasonable! Qohen ignores him. Joby grabs his coat and turns to leave, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do, Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three doctors sit at one end of a long table, grayish lig from an overcast day sifting through the window behind th At the head sits DOCTOR #1, a prim woman in a drab busine suit. She polishes her bifocals with a tissue. To her right sits DOCTOR #2, a middle-aged man in hospita scrubs that reveal a NicoDerm patch on his upper arm. He chews a wad of Nicorette gum while perusing Qohen's file. DOCTOR #3 slouches to Doctor #1's left. A handsome young in a white lab coat, stethoscope draped around his neck, gazes out the window with the soulful look of a bored poe Qohen sits stone-faced at the far end of the table. Doctor #1 puts on her glasses to appraise him.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: And this is...? Doctor #2 nervously clicks his pen, chomping on his gum.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Qohen Leth, Ontological Research Division, requesting Disability Leave.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Or reassignment to work at home.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: That's a Management decision, Mr. Leth. We only deal with health issues here. What seems to be the problem?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're dying.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Who's "we"?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Us. Ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: But there's only the one of you.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: So it would appear. Doctor #3 SNIFFS, returns to gazing out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (consulting file) Subject's had five physicals in the last year. He's healthy as a horse. Doctor #1 takes the file from him, scanning it.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: What makes you think you're dying?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We can feel it. Deep inside us...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Heart's strong as an ox. (a frustrated puff on pen) BP and cholesterol I could only dream of.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Our hair has fallen out.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Idiopathic.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Perfectly harmless. The tests don't lie.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Then the tests are merely mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: According to your file, you're the most productive number cruncher in your --

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Entity cruncher. Our data is much more complex than mere numbers.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Dying people are rarely so productive.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, we're dying.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: No you're not.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Yes we are.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: No you're not!

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Yes we are.  10. Doctor #2 grabs the Nicorette pack, savagely rips loose a piece of gum and shoves it in his mouth. Doctor #3, supremely bored now, uses his stethoscope to listen to his own heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should get another opinion.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Oh, let me do this one! Please? Doctor #1 nods. Doctor #3 sits up, clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: From the moment we're born, we all begin to die. Sooner or later, beggar or king, death comes to all.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: That will do, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: But it's true.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Where'd you get your degree?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Disability request denied. It's back to work for you, Mr. Leth. Qohen rises to leave, defeated. Doctor #1 takes off her glasses, studying him.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: This board must also recommend that you seek psychiatric evaluation. Doctor #2 waves a CD-ROM.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I saw this coming a mile away.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We've seen psychiatrists in the past. It's proven to be a waste of our time. We must stay home to wait for our call.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You'll have time for this one. He slides the CD-ROM down the table. Qohen picks it up. T cover reads: DR. SHRINK-ROM: INTERACTIVE PSYCHIATRIST.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: She makes house calls.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joby stands in Qohen's doorway, arms folded.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Didn't figure the medics would help, but Joby's here. I can get Management to see you. He'll be at my party tonight.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Party?

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) Guess you missed your invitation. Whole office is coming, including Management himself. Just show up. I'll take care of the rest.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're afraid we can't.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: What, gotta stay home and shampoo? Joby playfully musses Qohen's hairless head but, seeing h frigid expression, quickly stops.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We fear parties... We especially fear living rooms at parties... We never know quite... where to stand. Joby stares, then suddenly LAUGHS, slapping him on the ba

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: You kill me, Quinn. See you tonight. Joby leaves. Qohen takes a deep breath to calm himself.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: It's Qohen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen uncomfortably plods his way through a room crowded CO-WORKERS. He is lost amid the LAUGHTER AND CONVERSATION He passes a couple of CO-WORKERS who eye him derisively.

dialogues.speaker: CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Who's the geeky goth?

dialogues.speaker: CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Cube zombie. Some kind of Einstein.  12. Qohen bumps into BAINSLEY, 20s, wearing a loudly-patterne dress her buxom figure seems to be bursting out of. Qohen steps to his right just as Bainsley steps to her le She steps to her left just as Qohen shifts to his right. Bainsley GIGGLES, still blocking his way.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: I love the look. Fifty-first century human, the final evolutionary product. Maximum brain, minimalist body. Qohen stares at her, then clumsily makes his way past her Qohen finds Joby, obviously tipsy, laughing with a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Party boy! You made it!

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Is Management here? The group looks at Qohen strangely. Joby LAUGHS uncomfortably, takes Qohen's arm, and moves him away.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: (whispering) You wanna start a rumor riot?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Where is Management?

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Probably on his way. Soon as I spot him, I'll let you know. Meantime... Joby slaps Qohen on the back. Qohen flinches.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (loudly) Lighten up, have a little fun for a change. Mingle, Quinn, mingle!

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: It's Qohen.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Of course it is. Joby gives Qohen a push on his way. As Qohen looks for a place to retreat from the party crus NOISES FADE. He enters a quiet corner of the room.  13.

dialogues.speaker: DIMLY-LIT CORNER
dialogues.text: Two wing-back chairs flank a table with a reading lamp. In the furthest chair sits MANAGEMENT, dressed in the sam taupe suit featured in the poster in Qohen's office, a su that, chameleon-like, matches the color of the chair. He blends in so well that, at first, Qohen doesn't even see But when he does, Qohen stops, takes a step back. Management holds a book at eye level. With his other hand he balances a teacup and saucer on his knee. Apparently engrossed in his reading, Management lifts the teacup, ta a delicate sip, and returns the cup carefully to its sauc Qohen quietly turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT
dialogues.text: I take it you're not happy, Mr. Leth. Qohen hesitates, startled.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Do we... know you? Still not looking at Qohen, Management turns a page.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT
dialogues.text: I know you, Mr. Leth. Sit. Qohen grimaces in the direction of the party, then nervou perches on the edge of the empty chair. Management sips from his teacup, eyes riveted on the page

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What seems to be the problem?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We... We simply want to go home. Qohen notices Management's bland disinterest.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We could easily double our output there. Management turns another page. Qohen drums his fingers on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our chief concern is that we might miss our call... You see, we have been waiting for a certain call all our lives now...  14. Management stops reading, slowly looks up from his book.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .+-and although the nature and origin of our call remain quintessentially a mystery to us, we can't help but hope it will provide us with a purpose we've long lived without. Management studies Qohen for a moment, then blinks and returns his attention to his book.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT
dialogues.text: You're quite insane, Mr. Leth. Qohen stands, cowed by Management's bland disinterest.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're sorry to have disturbed you. He turns and flees to the...

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Bainsley hovers over a tray of hors d'oeuvres, stuffing h face. She spies Qohen making for the door. Suddenly a drunken Joby snags Qohen.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Quinn, you chrome-domed bastard! Where are you going? Have a drink! Eat!

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We saw him.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Management. People nearby overhear and turn to stare quizzically. Job makes a show of LAUGHING skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Better watch the cocktails, Quinn! (pulling him aside, whispering) Are you crazy? Management parties incognito!

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: This isn't working, Mr. Joby.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: No shit! You're blowing his cover!  15.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're afraid we must go now.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Wait. I'll get you a meeting with him. Joby steers Qohen to the buffet table.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're not leaving without eating, Quinn!

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: It's Qohen. We've apparently had our meeting. And our diet dictates against all foods with perceptible flavor.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Eat. That's an order. Qohen surveys the food tray grimly. He SIGHS, selects an olive, and tucks it into his mouth, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (loudly) Plenty of eats! Joby slaps Qohen on the back. Qohen GULPS, lodging the olive deep in his throat.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Plenty more! Plenty for everybody! Joby moves off, drunkenly glad-handing other guests. Qohen stumbles away, struggling for breath.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Away from the crowd, Qohen falls against the wall, panic- stricken. He pounds his chest, trying to free the olive. He lurches to an open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: STUDY
dialogues.text: As if by magic, Management sits behind a mahogany desk reading his book and sipping his tea. His eyes move from book to Qohen with an expression of mild amusement.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT
dialogues.text: What is the meaning of life, Mr. Leth? Qohen clutches his throat, eyes bulging.  16.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So close to its end, and still no answer. Management closes his book.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a special project for you that might prove to be mutually beneficial. The room blurs.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But there's not much time, Mr. Leth. Not much time at all... Qohen's knees buckle... And then he is suddenly lifted off his feet from behind a dragged back into the...

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Bainsley performs the Heimlich maneuver on Qohen. She los her balance, stumbles down the narrow corridor with him. hangs on fiercely, heaving him off his feet again and aga The olive SHOOTS from his mouth, ricochets off the wall a rolls to a stop by the baseboard. Instantly a scruffy rod appears, grabs the olive and disappears back into the wal Bainsley releases her hold. Qohen gasps for breath.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: I thought I smelled trouble. The neckline of Bainsley's dress is tugged low. She blith plumps her breasts while rearranging her clothing.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everybody hates to make a scene, but the worst thing you can do is go off by yourself. Embarrassment's the number one cause of choking deaths. Qohen stares into her eyes, speechless. He suddenly beeli for the bathroom. Closes the door. Locks it.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Qohen splashes water on his face. He stares at himself in the mirror. He reaches to touch his reflection... then staggers backward with a look of pain. He sits on the toilet seat, face buried in his hands. A loud KNOCK at the door. Qohen jumps to his feet, startl  17.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Still alive in there? Qohen quickly dries his face and opens the door. Bainsley squeezes past him, hands him her wine glass.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold this. She heads for the toilet, hiking her dress to the top of thighs. Qohen stares. Bainsley smiles...

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Care to join me?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Excuse us?

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: (winking) Close the door... I won't be long.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Qohen closes the door and stands uncomfortably, wine in h He sniffs it distastefully, then eases to the study.

dialogues.speaker: STUDY
dialogues.text: Qohen scans the room, puzzled. Management is gone.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Qohen stands obediently outside the bathroom door. The toilet FLUSHES. The faucet RUNS. The door opens. Bainsley exits, smoothing her dress. She flashes Qohen a sexy smile, takes the wine glass from him

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: So I saved your life. No big deal?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Forgive our ambivalence. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: You owe me. I'm Bainsley. She takes his hand in hers, looks him up and down.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you are...?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Qohen. Q--no U--  18.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: You work with these people?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: In a manner of speaking.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We crunch entities.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: You got a mouse in your pocket?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Excuse us?

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Who's "we"?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Us. Ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Catchy. She tugs at her dress as if uncomfortable with its fit.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're staring at me. You think my dress is incredibly ugly.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We -- we really should be going --

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: It's my daddy's fault. He used to buy me these incredibly ugly clothes to keep the boys away. Didn't work. Only made me want to get naked, and that's no way to keep the boys away. So I never developed a fashion sense. Are you on drugs?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Have you tried them?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We have tried many pharmaceuticals, both therapeutic and recreational, but we've discovered none with sufficient potency to treat our essential condition.  She leans 19.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: I hear you. You should try natural herbs. I'm happy with the herbs. Way happy. They should put St. John's Wort in the drinking water, like fluoride... close and rests an elbow on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Are you here alone?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We are generally everywhere alone.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: The "we" thing: royal or plural?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Generic. She trails her fingernails over the skin of his scalp.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Love it. You're the enigmatic workaholic technogeek. I'm the mysterious party- girl. My place or yours?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We'd only disappoint you.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Best line I've heard all night. Her lips move close to his. Qohen pulls back, flustered.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We can't imagine your interest in us.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: I saved your life. That's a turn-on.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We really must be leaving. Bainsley touches a finger to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Seriously. We could have some fun. She caresses his chest, pulls a felt-tip pen from his poc and scrawls her name and number on the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call me. Qohen stares at his hand.  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen scrubs his hand in scalding water. He looks at hims in the mirror. Steam obscures his reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gulls SCREECH. The surf CRASHES and ROARS. Young Qohen is buried in the sand up to his neck. His Wife tamps the sand down, LAUGHING, while his Son decorates the mound with seashells. Qohen struggles gamel to free himself, grinning with red-faced delight. Then his face goes slack, and he stares straight out at h inevitable future with a mixture of fear and revulsion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen studies the photo. He traces Young Qohen's smile wi his finger, then turns the picture's face to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joby leads Qohen past a maze of cubicles. Sounds of TYPIN CONVERSATION, phones RINGING. Qohen hastens to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Be careful what you wish for, Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: What's this all about?

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: You're going home. Management assigned you to the Zero Theorem Project. He's been hand-picking talent to crunch it since before I was hired. So far, no luck. The Clones are at your place right now setting up your hardware.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Clones?

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Research and Development techies. They already changed the locks. Not to worry. You'll get a key. They reach a door labelled "MANCOM". Joby unlocks it.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got my money on you, Quinn. Some big, bad entities to crunch, but I'm sure you'll be proving the theorem in no time.  21.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: What exactly will we be proving?

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Don't ask. It's all very hush-hush... Joby opens the door, releasing a cold fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cavernous room filled with blinking banks of HUMMING, ceiling-high computers. Qohen can see his breath.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: .+. But just between you and me... You solve Zip-T, I bet Management helps you get you that call of yours. Qohen stops -- surprised, hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: He can do that? But how? Joby tugs Qohen's sleeve, pulls him forward.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Management works in mysterious ways, Quinn. As they walk down an aisle, a faint CLICKING grows louder

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is ManCom, biggest neural net computer in the world. Learns just like a human, trial and error, but a hell of a lot faster. Already the smartest thing on the planet... and still learning! They turn a corner. BOB, 15 -- frail, anemic, baggy-eyed -- sits at the contr console rapidly CLICKING a mouse. He's bundled in heavy jacket, hooded sweatshirt, scarf and fingerless gloves. A row of monitors flash dizzying images, a fast-changing encyclopedic array of charts, pictures, and geometric cod

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Working hard, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (without looking up) Hardly working, Bob. Still teaching this stupid motherfucker... Excuse my French.  22.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Don't mind me. I'm just getting Quinn here started on Zip-T. Bob pulls off his hood to reveal a ratty pony tail. He gi Qohen a sideways glance.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I give him two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: To complete the project?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (rolling eyes) Till you crash and burn, Bob. Joby pulls Qohen past Bob, turning another corner.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: That was Bob.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: But he called you Bob. He called us Bob.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Bob calls everybody Bob. Says it's a waste of brain cells remembering names. QOHEN ; Isn't he rather young to be working here?

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Kid could program before he could walk. They reach a row of file cabinets. Joby opens a drawer, pulls out a stack of CD-ROMs, piles them into Qohen's han

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crunch this stuff for starters. Upload ASAP. ManCom will send you new downloads every day. Miss a deadline, you're off the project. How's that for pressure? Joby gives him more disks. Overwhelmed, Qohen struggles t keep from dropping them. Joby reaches into the drawer aga

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Quinn. You got what you wanted. Everything's under control. Joby holds up the last disk, stares through its hole.  23.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ever get the feeling the whole universe is a big fat cosmic joke... and maybe you're the punch line...? You ever get that feeling, Quinn?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: It's Qohen. Joby tucks the final disk into Qohen's shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... That's what I figured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1. Qohen working at his computer, featuring several bulky new drives. Geometric hieroglyphics scroll down the monit 2. Monitor showing file download in progress. 3. Qohen ordering generic groceries from a website. 4. Qohen standing at his KITCHEN counter, eating a bland, joyless meal from a microwaveable container. 5. Qohen crunching entities. His new touch tone phone RINGS. He answers hopefully. He listens, hope dimming, th punches several buttons on the touch tone. 6. Monitor showing file upload in progress. 7. Qohen at his BATHROOM mirror rubbing baggy eyes. 8. Entities scrolling at breakneck speed on monitor, Qohe fingers flying on the keyboard, his expression grim. 9. Qohen lying awake in bed, tired eyes restless. 10. Qohen at the shrine lights a candle, gazes at the can flame as the match burns down to his fingers, unnoticed. 11. A framed photo of Qohen's Wife and Son walking hand i hand through a field of wildflowers. The photo comes to life, and Wife and Son look out, startled and saddened. 12. Qohen stares at the photo, eyes moistening. He turns and walks out of the alcove to his computer, raising his to the crucifix. Mounted where Jesus' head should be, a MANCAM trains its lens on him, the lens morphing into... 13. The Black Hole... A phone RINGS... fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen at his computer, the ManCam trained on him.  24. Qohen's monitor: DR. SHRINK-ROM, 50s, an interactive CD-R therapist. Warm and caring, she sits in a great leather chair, notebook in hand, pen poised.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: You seem tense, Qohen. Perhaps you'd like to start over. Let's return to the subject of your fears.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We fear... (deep breath) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're afraid we can't.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Of course you can. Let's explore this contradiction. You say you fear nothing, but in previous sessions... A notebook window pops up next to Dr. Shrink-ROM, showing bulleted list she reads from.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...you've reported fear of death, fear of life, fear of open spaces, fear of closed spaces, fear of people, fear of missing a certain phone call, fear of -- Qohen moves his cursor to close the notebook window.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We fear many things, but ultimately we fear nothing more than anything.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Noted. Please go on.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: In what manner, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Are you trying to be difficult?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Not at all... It seems we're capable of being difficult without trying.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd like to start over. We've spoken of your fears. Would you care to discuss your joys?  25.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: At present, we can think of very little that brings us joy.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: (gently) Your wife and son were a source of joy. Weren't they, Qohen? Qohen's eyes cloud.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why don't you ever talk about them?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: What good is joy when it doesn't last? We haven't felt joy in years.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Tell me what you're feeling, Qohen.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We feel... nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: You're a tough nut to crack, Qohen... and of course I don't mean "nut" in the pejorative sense... Perhaps you'd like to start over. Let's return to -- The phone RINGS, interrupting. Qohen looks at it with a mixture of hope and despair. He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello... Qohen Leth... Your next installment of data is due for upload in one hour. If the target timetable is attainable, press one. If not -- Qohen presses 2, interrupting the voice.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Please enter estimated number of minutes needed for target overrun. Qohen hesitates, considering, then presses 1-2-0.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A moment, please... ManCom will allow 70 minutes. Goodbye... Qohen Leth. QOHEN . That's not enough time!  26. The line has gone dead. Qohen hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Perhaps you should get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: What difference does it make? We'll never finish. ManCom sends new downloads before we've finished with the old ones. We've never worked with data like this. It refuses to stay crunched!

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Deep breaths, Qohen, deep breaths... Qohen stares up at the crucifix. ManCam's red light shine

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: All we want is our call...

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Yes... Your call... Let's continue our discussion next session. I find your feelings fascinating and look forward -- Qohen clicks on exit, and Dr. Shrink-ROM vanishes. He types a command, and a menu bar reads: ZERO THEOREM PROJECT. A stream of signs and symbols scroll. With a pained expression he goes to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen at his computer, feverishly typing. A STORM rages outside, and his driven eyes are lit by LIGHTNING FLASHES He stops typing, freezing the scrolling signs and symbols

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: This can't be right... Qohen types a command, and the entities begin scrolling i reverse. He slows the stream of symbols, stops.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nothing adds up... He resumes his typing, the symbols scrolling faster and faster as he works himself into a frenzied pace. Suddenly, LIGHTNING FLASHES and the PHONE RINGS. With a cry of pain, Qohen snatches up the receiver.  27.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello! Hello!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Qohen Leth... Data is overdue for upload. Please enter estimated number of minutes needed for target overrun. Qohen savagely punches numbers.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That time frame is not authorized... Please enter estimated number... Qohen drops the phone. The message repeats itself. Symbol scroll in a dizzying blur. Qohen stares at the monitor in despair... Then his eyes narrow in anger... He opens a file drawer, rummages through it wildly, and p out a ball-peen hammer. He looks at it, eyes full of doub He hesitates a moment, then -- decided -- lifts it high. Dr. Shrink-ROM suddenly pops up on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Deep breaths, Qohen. Perhaps a mild sedative is in order. I can arrange -- Qohen SMASHES the monitor, shorting out Dr. Shrink-ROM. The storm looses a LIGHTNING BOLT. Qohen turns the hammer to the phone. SMASH! Qohen looks around wildly. His gaze moves to the shrine a lingers a moment. He lifts his eyes to the crucifix ManCa He raises the hammer. A look of despair crosses his face. All is quiet... except the distant RUMBLE of thunder and soft PATTER of rain on the roof. The storm has passed. Qohen lets the hammer drop to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen lies on his bed, his expression blank. The intercom BUZZES repeatedly. Qohen slowly rises, walks the door, and presses the intercom. ves? QOHEN es?  28.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Phoneman. Management says you got a problem. Let me in, buddy. Qohen buzzes the street door open.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: QOHEN opens his door to a white jump-suited Joby, who whe in a hefty duffel bag and throws an arm around Qohen.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Quinn! Long time no hug! Qohen goes rigid, awkwardly backs away.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Still dying, I see.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Field work. I love it. Gets me out of the office and into a snappy uniform. Qohen follows Joby to the work station. CHUCKLING, Joby genuflects before the crucifix. He rises, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You could use a woman's touch, Quinn. Qohen closes his eyes, jaw clenched.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ManCom can't reach you. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: At present, we are having difficulty maintaining our upload schedule. Our entities are acting strangely... Joby pokes at the broken monitor, eyebrows raised.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Personnel meltdown. Seen plenty of it. Me, I'd yank you and go to the bullpen. Joby glances at the shattered phone, then picks up the ba peen hammer from the floor, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But Management's giving you another chance. Don't ask me why. Qohen takes the hammer from him, puts it in a file drawer  29. Joby shrugs, pulls a new phone from his duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's all about connections, Quinn. Wires and wireless weaving a world wide web. Can't do anything if you're disconnected. He plugs in the phone, then pulls a new monitor from his duffel bag. He wipes imaginary sweat from his brow.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa. Manual labor makes me parched. Got a spare beer for a working man?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We have tap water.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Yum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joby guzzles a tepid glass of water, BURPS.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: I've missed you, Quinn. A supervisor doesn't make many friends, you know.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: You consider us a friend?

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Sure do. (conspiratorially) So tell me, what's the real problem?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: The Zero Theorem is unprovable. We're dying. We haven't received our call.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: (nodding) You don't trust Management.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Nothing adds up.

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: Or maybe everything adds up to nothing.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Joby slaps Qohen on the back, making him jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor bastard. All stressed out... I know someone in the decompression business who might be able to help. Might even help you get that call of yours... Who knows? Let me see what I can do, Quinn.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: It's Qohen. Q--no U--O-H --

dialogues.speaker: JOBY
dialogues.text: No need to spell it out. Joby's here.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK HOLE
dialogues.text: Light swirls violently around the inky blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen sits up in bed, struggling to orient himself. computer's glow illuminates his face. He tilts his There is a distant BUZZ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen presses the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Troubleshooter. Buzz me in, babe.
The head. Qohen opens the door, revealing BAINSLEY. Dressed all in white with plunging neckline and short skirt, she looks l a nurse outfitted by Frederick's of Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: «+. You... You're... Bainsley...?

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: You never called. I waited forever!

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: She steps in, inspecting Qohen closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look awful, poor thing. Joby's right. You need me.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Mr. Joby sent you...?

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Joby doesn't send me anywhere. (pausing, looking around) We're just neighbors. She walks up the aisle in wonder. Qohen follows.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't believe you live in a church. How otherworldly. I feel so... holy!

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: It's a chapel, actually. Bainsley turns to him, grasping his arm.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: (singing off-key) Go-ing to the chap-el of loooove... She marches him up the aisle, clutching his arm.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: (flustered) We prefer not to be touched. Bainsley makes no move to turn him loose.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: The rent must be outrageous.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Actually, we own the building. We bought it from an insurance company. There'd been extensive... fire damage... Qohen glances toward the shrine, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The previous occupants were an order of gnostic monks who'd sworn vows of poverty, chastity, and silence... Apparently... No one broke his vow to yell, "Fire".

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Holy frying friars! They reach the work station, but Bainsley pulls Qohen to bed. She places a hand on his chest and pushes him backwa  32. Qohen plops on the mattress. Smiling coyly, Bainsley lean over him, fingernails grazing his bald head.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have the most intriguing bone structure, so polished, so pure... Qohen opens his mouth to speak, but Bainsley puts a finge his lips. She spins around and strides to the computer.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mighty big hard drive you got here... She sits in front of the computer, begins typing.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Mr. Joby seemed to think you might help us get our call.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, he mentioned the call thing... (without looking) You're staring at me.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're terribly sorry. Bainsley squints at the screen, typing rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: This is the goopiest software I've ever seen. But your hardware's dreamy. I can definitely work with your hardware.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Our problem is not with our computer. Bainsley suddenly SQUEALS, swiveling away from the comput She sucks on her middle finger, teary-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: I just broke a nail on your big, fat, stupid keyboard! Qohen jumps up and goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We'll get our first aid kit.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: (pouting) Could you please just kiss it?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Excuse us?  33.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Whenever I hurt myself, my daddy would kiss it and make it all better. Qohen stands wringing his hands.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We fail to see how --

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Please...? Qohen hesitates, then bends to place a hasty kiss on the of her outstretched finger.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You call that a kiss? Bainsley takes his hand, slowly sucks his middle finger i her mouth. Her lips slide down and up, lingering on the fingertip in a soft kiss. Her eyes dance with mischief.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There... all better...? Puzzled, paralyzed, pitiful, Qohen stares into her eyes. Dr. Shrink-ROM pops onto the computer.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: I realize I'm not authorized to present an opinion, but I couldn't help noticing this woman's attempt to project issues of paternal abandonment onto you. Given the age difference between the two of you, as your psychiatrist, I must warn you -- Bainsley grabs the mouse, clicks on exit. Dr. Shrink-ROM vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Nosy bitch. My daddy didn't abandon me. He died. Qohen opens his mouth as if to speak... Bainsley touches his cheek. Qohen stares into her eyes a moment... then draws away, breaking the spell. He turns his back to her. Bainsley rises, wanders toward the shrine, gazing about.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can help you, Qohen... but you're going to be a challenge...  34. She reaches for one of the pictures, goes to flip it forw

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's your interior decorator? Qohen snaps to attention, rushes toward her.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Don't! Don't touch those! Qohen pulls her away. The picture falls face-down on the floor, glass CRACKING. Qohen quickly picks it up, careful re-hangs it, face to the wall. He breathes heavily.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: I prefer not to be manhandled. Regaining control, Qohen turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We didn't mean to hurt you. Bainsley rubs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: In case you got the wrong idea, I should tell you I don't do sexual intercourse any more. I don't care if a guy wraps himself up like a latex mummy, nothing's going inside me. Way too dangerous. She shrugs it off, smiling slowly.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm into bioteletantric interfacing now. It's smart and safe and -- oh my God! -- it feels so super-tingly! She spins away on a spiked heel, short dress flaring.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got anything to eat around here? I'm starving my butt off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bainsley perches prettily on the counter, feet dangling, devouring a microwaved meal. Qohen leans against the sink watching her. She licks her fingers, mouth full.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: How can you stand this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We've grown accustomed to it. She stops chewing, swallows.  35.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: You're staring at me again.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: (looking away) Forgive us.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: You're forgiven already.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: In our experience, forgiveness doesn't come so easily.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: What kind of guilt trip are you on? Qohen doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here you are, locked up all alone... waiting... for what? A phone call? What's that all about?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We prefer not to speak of it. Our past is... painful... Bainsley hops down from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Who's isn't? She touches his arm. Qohen flinches. She strokes his tens neck, Qohen visibly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm here to help, Qohen. Trust me. Confession's good for the soul.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Assuming we have a soul...

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Everybody has a soul.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: That remains to be proven. Bainsley draws away, studying him.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: So I saved your life for nothing...? Qohen wilts with guilt.  36.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Qohen. How can I help if you won't tell me anything? Qohen meets her eyes then looks away. He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We... we can't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Why not? Qohen looks away, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: You're staring at us...

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Bainsley pokes through cupboards and drawers, trying her not to look at Qohen. Qohen stands in the middle of the kitchen, eyes closed, h clasped nervously. His voice is low, on the edge of breaking.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We suffered... a great loss... and we struggled for a long time to understand the reason for it... the reason we were chosen, if chosen we were, to go on living with this misfortune... We came to this place... It seemed to suit us... We stopped eating. We dulled our pain with drink and drugs. We lost all hope... We came to this place to die... Qohen's face glows with a tortured fervor. Bainsley glances at him. Her eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One night a storm struck. We lost power. We lit candles. And in the flickering shadows, we decided to end our lives. We ingested every drug we could find... Bainsley stands at the sink, turning the water on and off

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then the phone rang... We answered... A voice said, "Qohen Leth," and suddenly we felt a flash of light... We felt... a current of pure energy connecting us to something... something greater... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We suddenly knew clearly that we only had to answer, say "Yes," and the voice would reveal the purpose behind our loss... would give us a reason to go on... Bainsley turns from the sink.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: .--And then...? Qohen opens his eyes. His gaze is bland, lifeless.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We awoke in a hospital emergency room.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: And you've been waiting for a callback ever since? Qohen nods.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What kind of drugs did you take?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: You think we're insane.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: It could've been somebody selling time shares... I mean... Life goes on, Qohen.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: So it would appear. The question is... to what end...? And we doubt you can help us in providing an answer. Bainsley goes to him. She worries the buttons on his shir head lowered. She raises her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: I can try... Let me try. Gently, Qohen pulls her hands from his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We told you. We prefer not to be touched. Bainsley bites her lip.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: I can get around that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying scattered about the work station: open boxes, compu parts, accessories and cables.  38. Bainsley models a VIRTUAL REALITY SUIT, a tight, transluc shimmering red sheath that covers her from head to toe. She pirouettes seductively, showing all her curves. Sequi like transistors sparkle all over. A braid of wires hangs from her hood down her back, ending in a computer jack.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: This thing is years ahead of the competition. It works on all the nerve endings, of course, plus it's synched directly to the brain's synapses. She pulls off the hood, shaking her hair free.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think? Joby said it's based on one of your projects. Qohen sits stiffly on his bed, staring doubtfully.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We never imagined our projects actually had any purpose.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Don't put it on your resume yet. Top secret. I'm the cyberspace test pilot. She pulls an identical and incredibly tiny-looking suit f a box, drapes it across Qohen's lap.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For you.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're supposed to wear this?

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: One size fits all. She strokes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can help you, Qohen. Trust me. She turns, suddenly efficient, and marches for the door.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I bookmarked my website for you. Just put on the suit, plug in, and click on me at midnight.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: You're going out dressed like that?  39.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: They can look but they can't touch. (blowing him a kiss) Oh! I can't wait! Don't be late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen stands before the mirror, wearing the virtual reali suit. He tugs uncomfortably at the crotch.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: (muttering) One size does not fit all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suited up, with braid of wires connected to his computer, Qohen sits before his monitor. Bainsley's website feature picture of lingerie-clad Bainsley and the words "ENTER ME Qohen moves his cursor to "ENTER". DR. SHRINK-ROM pops up on the screen, her face troubled.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Don't, Qohen.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Don't what?

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Don't use this girl.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We have no intentions of --

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You've built a wall around yourself. Is she prepared for what she'll find inside? Qohen slowly removes his hood.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's an emotionally damaged girl. You are emotionally bereft. Listen, Qohen...

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: This interruption is unacceptable. We insist you run a scan on your program. Dr. Shrink-ROM frowns, nods slowly. Her movements run in reverse for a moment -- RESET -- then snap back to normal

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: So sorry. The glitch is fixed. Don't mind me. Carry on, Qohen.  40. Dr. Shrink-ROM disappears. Qohen stares, perplexed. Bainsley's sexy image awaits. Qohen hesitates, then pulls down the hood, clicks on "ENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swaying palm trees reach for a deep blue sky above. Wearing swimming trunks, Qohen lies on a blanket spread o the sand. He gazes skyward, puts a hand to his head to discover... a full head of hair!

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Like it? Bainsley kneels beside him, wearing a skimpy bikini. They lie on a beach, ocean before them, lush jungle behin them. The sun sets, the horizon awash with color. Bainsley pulls food from a picnic basket -- stone crab, chilled asparagus spears, a loaf of bread -- arranging it the blanket. Champagne chills in a bucket beside her.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I made it just for you -- the hair. Something special for a special guy. Qohen runs his hands through his hair, eyes distant.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're not sure it's quite... us.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. Bainsley hands the bottle of champagne to Qohen.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Actually, we don't drink any longer.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: You can do anything you want here. You can drink and never get drunk. You can eat and never get full. She picks up a crab claw, produces a ball-peen hammer... Qohen flinches as she SMASHES the claw open. She pulls a huge chunk of crab from the shell, takes a savage, giggling bite, brings the morsel to Qohen's mouth Qohen recoils, but Bainsley insists, pressing it to his l  4l. He takes a tentative nibble and, despite himself... shive with pleasure. He grabs the rest and fills his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good? Qohen looks at her, swallows, regains his reserve.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Where is this place?

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: All in your mind... from my mind. My father used to clip pictures from travel magazines and put them on the fridge. When he saved up, we were going to take a vacation to some exotic tropical island. A fleeting look of sadness crosses Bainsley's face, but s GIGGLES suddenly, and it is gone. She takes Qohen's hand, kisses his fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you feel this, Qohen? Qohen melts for a moment, then freezes up.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: It's not real. Bainsley sits back.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: It's better than real. You're in your computer. I'm in mine. We're connected by memory chips and fiber optics. We're safe here, Qohen. This is my place.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: But what about our call? Bainsley puts a finger to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: You worry too much. She takes an asparagus spear, nibbles its tip, eyes danci

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trust me, Qohen. Qohen looks at her in wonder. She grabs the champagne and thrusts it in his hands.  42.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's get this party started! Qohen holds the bottle awkwardly. Bainsley guides his han kisses him lightly on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pop your cork, boyfriend. Qohen looks into her eyes, then, struggling, POPS the cor Foam bubbles out of the bottle. Bainsley lunges over him to lap at it. She grabs the bott and pours into his upturned mouth. Bainsley LAUGHING and Qohen SPUTTERING, they roll and wre in the sand, champagne pouring all over them...

dialogues.speaker: JUNGLE, BEACH
dialogues.text: 1. Qohen and Bainsley walk a jungle path. Bainsley plucks flower, puts it behind Qohen's ear. He touches her hand. 2. Bainsley climbs a tree, beckoning Qohen to follow. He shakes his head. She showers him with handfuls of leaves, then gives a TARZAN YELL and swings down on a vine, colli with Qohen and knocking them both tumbling, LAUGHING. 3. Qohen and Bainsley sit at the shore, watching the suns Bainsley stands, stretches, wades into the surf. She turn motions for Qohen to join her. He shakes his head. She folds her arms sternly. He shakes his head again. She splashes him. Qohen stands dripping, then, WHOOPING, dive in, surfacing before her and locking her in an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: STAY IN SCENE
dialogues.text: They gaze into each other's eyes. She kisses him. He kiss her back. Bainsley takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Whoa. Who knew? Qohen holds her, eyes troubled. Bainsley kisses him again, the passion building. Self-consciously, Qohen breaks away, wades out of the wat Bainsley follows him with her eyes, SIGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen and Bainsley, wrapped in a blanket before a campfir She bites into a tropical fruit. He stares out to sea.  43. The sun is still setting into the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Shouldn't the sun have set by now?

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: I like to keep it this way. Bainsley puts the fruit to Qohen's lips. He takes a bite, chews slowly. Tears well up in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We don't deserve this.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Don't deny yourself, Qohen. She grabs his arm excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Want to have some fun? Take us someplace else. A place all your own. Just imagine it. The virtual program will do the rest.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're not at all certain --

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, you. You're never certain. Come on, take a chance. I'm giving you the controls, Qohen. Relax, close your eyes. Reluctantly, Qohen reclines, closing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now take us someplace special. Picture it in your mind. Qohen's face tenses with effort. Bainsley leans over him, strokes his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Easy, Qohen. Don't strain your brain... Just imagine... Qohen grits his teeth, his expression turning tortured.

dialogues.speaker: SPACE
dialogues.text: Bald, naked, and curled tightly in the fetal position, Qo floats amid a backdrop of brilliant stars. His eyes open wide, staring, as he fights the dread inside him.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY
dialogues.text: Wow! What an imagination! Bainsley, also naked, slowly orbits around Qohen, revelli in the freedom of zero gravity.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And what a dirty mind! Where's my bikini, Mr. Leth? Oblivious, Qohen continues to stare past her. Bainsley floats closer, facing him.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong? She reaches for him, draws his rigid body close, then tur her head to follow his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK HOLE
dialogues.text: A maelstrom of blazing interstellar dust and matter spira into its black depths, carrying Bainsley and Qohen with i Bainsley freaks. She hugs Qohen tight, and now they are tumbling end over end.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, Qohen, stop it! Make it stop! With great effort, Qohen tears his gaze from the spinning fiery black hole and shuts his eyes tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen's eyes snap open to a room engulfed by flames. Qohen COUGHS, GASPS, smoke so thick he can barely see. From far away, his Wife's plaintive voice...

dialogues.speaker: WIFE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Qohen! Qohen! -.. then his Son's...

dialogues.speaker: SON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Daddy!  45. Burning beams fall all around him.

dialogues.speaker: BAINSLEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Qohen! Qohen! Qohen stumbles through the smoke and fire, crashes throug window...

dialogues.speaker: WIFE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Qohen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen lands with a whiplash effect, seated before his computer. Trembling, he slowly removes his hood. COMPUTER MONITOR: Error messages flash. Symbols speed to HUMMING blur. Suddenly -- POP -- the screen goes black Qohen stares at his reflection in the screen, his face in shell-shocked torment. He slowly reaches for the screen. As his finger nears, a static spark CRACKLES. He jerks hi hand back, his face turning blank as a zombie's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen lies in bed, staring up at the crucifix. Intercom BUZZES. Qohen continues staring. Intercom BUZZES. Qohen blinks. Intercom BUZZES and BUZZES Qohen rises, makes his way to the door, presses the butto

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bob. Buzz me in.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Bob who?

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bob who has to take a wicked pee. Buzz me in, Scotty.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Our name isn't Scotty.  46.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I know that, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Our name isn't Bob.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like I give a shit. Come on, I'm doing the tinkle dance out here. Qohen frowns.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We're afraid our home is not a rest stop. There's a convenience store a block east. Qohen turns away from the intercom, returning to his bed.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They look at you funny unless you buy something. Buzz me in, Bob, I'm starting to dribble! The intercom BUZZES several more times then falls silent. The sound of RUNNING FOOTSTEPS from the vestibule. Qohen rises from bed just as the deadbolt turns and the door op Two acne-scarred young men, SLIM CLONE and CHUBS CLONE, s in the doorway, dressed in white short-sleeved shirts wit bulging pocket protectors, sloppy ties, thick glasses. Hi belted trousers show white socks in black wingtips. Hair slicked to the side, frazzled strands sticking up in back One is fat and the other skinny, but they could be twins. They enter, flank the doorway, look around suspiciously. Suddenly Bob races in. He's dressed in sneakers, untucked shirt and long, baggy shorts with huge cargo pockets. Headphones hang around his neck. He rushes up the aisle toward Qohen, face twisted in agon

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where's your bathroom?! Qohen stands gaping.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bathroom-bathroom-bathroom! Bob charges through the door to the kitchen. He WHIMPERS. He reappears in the doorway, face desperate. Qohen slowly points the direction. Bob races into the bathroom: the HISS of piss on porcelai  47. Qohen looks at the Clones, bewildered. They walk down the aisle side by side toward him. Bob exits the bathroom, wiping his brow dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Think I did some renal damage, holding it that long. Slim got stuck in traffic.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Chubs drove, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBS
dialogues.text: Fast as I could.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Can't tell you Clones apart anyway.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: What... What are you doing here? Bob ignores him, sits at the computer station.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (melodramatically) Black screen of death! He raises his hands, fingers spread, and carefully places them on the console, as if performing a Vulcan Mind Meld.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We asked you a perfectly simple --

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Shhh! How'm I supposed to do my job when you keep talking?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: What job? What's going on? Bob returns his attention to the screen. Slim approaches Qohen with a clipboard and pen.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Sign here.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Receipt of delivery.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: What delivery?  48.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBS
dialogues.text: Management's son. Assigned to help you.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Sign here. Overwhelmed, Qohen signs.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBS
dialogues.text: We'll pick him up in exactly four hours.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Don't lose him. They turn in unison and walk down the aisle and out the d Bob rises from his seat at the work station.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I wouldn't mess with the Clones, Bob. They look harmless, but they're the toughest geeks in Research and Development. They'd just as soon vaporize you as look at you. He unpacks computer components from his deep pockets.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you're a pretty scary looking guy yourself. Promise you won't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Of course we won't hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Not even my feelings, Bob. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Will you please stop calling us Bob?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: What do you want me to call you?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Mr. Leth would suffice.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Mr. Leth... Leth... Nah, too wormy.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Qohen, then. Q--no U--O-H-E-N.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You gotta buy another vowel, Q.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Q'll do. Q is you. Happy now? Qohen's irritation simmers.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: How can you possibly help us? Bob pulls tools from his pocket and opens up a hard drive

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: By getting you off your ass and back to work. No more messages from Darth Vader's phone doll. (mimicking COMPUTERIZED VOICE) "If the target timetable is attainable, yank your crank. If not, kiss my ass." No more candy-ass upload schedule. Bob pulls out a fried circuit board, replaces it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be your worst nightmare four hours a day, seven days a week, for the next four weeks. That's all he can spare me. You solve Zip-T by then or you're fired. Them's the terms from Daddy Dearest. He's tired of fucking around. Qohen's face hardens.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: And if we don't agree to those terms?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Then I don't get you your call. Qohen's mouth drops open.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: You? You can get us our call? Bob looks away.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: How the hell do I know? It's my first day on the job. All I know is... Bob fires up the computer. A hodgepodge of symbols flash fizzle, along with ERROR messages.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «+. no Zippidy-T, no ring-a-ding-dingy. Bob types rapidly, the screen changing, re-configuring Suddenly his own image appears on the screen, as recorded the ManCam hanging from the crucifix.  50.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotta disable this thing. How can you work with the old man gawking at you?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We have nothing to hide.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Right. Keep telling yourself that, Q. Bob types a series of commands. He stops, finger poised above the "Enter" key. He grins up at ManCam, waving. His image waves back on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bob's on the job, Dad... He hits "Enter" and his image disappears. ManCam blinks o Bob begins typing and clicking at superhuman speed.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I gotta clean up your mess... Pop quiz, Q. What's better, crunching Zip-T code or getting ass-banged by a troop of rabid baboons? Be sure to phrase your answer in the form of a question. Qohen blinks. Blinks again.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We wish you would curb your liberal use of profane language. It's... unseemly.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Excuse my freaking Fortran. Wouldn't want to seem unseemly.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Qohen lies in bed, staring at the ceiling. Bob pushes himself back from the computer, rubbing his ey He COUGHS, SNIFFLES, SNEEZES.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Are you coming down with something?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Usually. Bob wipes his nose on his sleeve, WHEEZING.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's it for today. I got your systems working, but I still gotta retrieve all the Zip-T shit from ManCom. It's gonna take a couple days at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're used to waiting.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not. Where are those bastards? Bob SNEEZES again. He pulls an asthma inhaler from pocket, takes a quick blast. The deadbolt clicks, the door opens, and the Clones Bob whirls, eyes fiery, and strides down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're late! Chubs and Slim check their watches.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBS
dialogues.text: Um. Bob. We're right on time.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: No excuses. Don't let it happen again. (to Qohen) I'll be back. You better be here too.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Where else would we possibly be?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: And by the way. You gotta lose the "we" thing. Too annoying. Ask Doc Shrink-ROM if you don't believe me. Vaya con fucking Dios, Q... excuse my Spanglish. 51. his enter. And with that Bob is out the door, the Clones on his heel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qohen at his computer in a session with Dr. Shrink-ROM.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: ... and apparently Management has assigned his son to get us our call. We fear he's much too young to be entrusted with a responsibility of such paramount importance. We fear that he --

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM
dialogues.text: Don't be such a wuss, Q. Qohen is speechless with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bob's a genius whiz-kid super-brain. And if you don't believe it...  52. Dr. Shrink-ROM stands. A RAP BEAT plays in the background

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yo, look. Shut up and listen. Qohen stares at her, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHRINK-ROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We cannot, won't not help you, Q, We wanna help you, ain't it true, But we won't help you get your call, We will not help you, not at all, Until you first shed verbal truss, First-person plural, Qs-R-Us... We got a plan for your sure cure, That gives you singular allure, But help from this computer whiz Must come without the plural biz... We do not like first-person plural...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob slouches at the computer, keying in more code.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You keep it up, I'm gonna hurl. Qohen lies in bed.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: We -- can't seem to help ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Jeez, it's like an audience with the queen here. How long you been talking this way?

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
dialogues.text: Ever since... Qohen hesitates, glances toward the shrine.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A former therapist suggested it as a temporary coping mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: That's pitiful. You gotta give it up, Q.

dialogues.speaker: QOHEN
